attributes.action: Add an interest cap to all new mortgage products
attributes.additional_details: With the current market turmoil and interest hikes, it has now become apparent that remortgaging and buying homes with a mortgage will be quite difficult in the coming months. It is projected that the base interest will be above 6% next year.  This would mean mortgages of above 10% which would be unaffordable for normal public.
attributes.background: Pass a law to protect both homeowners and buyers from this financial turmoil by putting a interest cap on the mortgage rates (example : mortgage interest rates cap of 5%).

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about mortgage rates are a matter for lenders, not the UK Government or Parliament.
